entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued May 07 at 1:36PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Snowmelt Flooding Possible Later This Week... All areas of Northern Alaska will see a warming trend to near or just above normal temperatures in the second half of this week. These warming temperatures, combined with a much above normal snowpack over most of the Interior, will cause a significant increase in snowmelt and push of water into drainage areas and
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Interior; Deltana and Tanana Flats; Denali; Eastern Alaska Range; Middle Tanana Valley; Southeastern Brooks Range; Upper Koyukuk Valley; Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country; Yukon Flats and Surrounding Uplands

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued May 07 at 6:59PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Butler and southern Crenshaw Counties through 745 PM CDT... At 658 PM CDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm 7 miles northwest of Dozier, or 14 miles southwest of Luverne, moving northeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in 35 to 40 mph and half inch hail.

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued May 06 at 9:54PM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MST/6 PM MDT/ MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding on Chinle Wash caused by snowmelt in the Chuska Mountains will continue through Monday. This is mainly due to flow over spillways of Tsaile Dam and Wheatfields Dam, bringing water down Canyon del Muerto and Coyote Wash.

entry.summary: ...High River Flows and Flooding due to Snowmelt...
